chargeHist.descr: Cause Child 13-18 to View Sex. Activity

result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert J Loderbauer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Expose Child to Harmful Material, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.11(2)(a).
  • Attempt Expose Child to Harmful Material, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.11(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
On Counts #1 & #2, the Court IMPOSES & STAYS 9 MONTHS JAIL, PER COUNT, CONSECUTIVE TO EACH OTHER AND CONSECUTIVE TO ANY OTHER SENTENCE IN BEING and places the Defendant on Probation for 3 years, each count, concurrent.


01-05-2015 The Court orders the verbage on the JOC be corrected re: sentence transfer to read "Sentence may transfer to another county-any county that will match his work needs".

miscConds.notes:
--To pay costs of $243
--To pay $200 DNA Surcharge

--Follow-through with all treatment recommendations of Dr. Cummings or any other treatment providers
--To undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--To maintain employment 
--No possession/use of any computer, cell phone or other device with internet or texting capabilities unless expressly approved by Agent but may use computer for employment purposes only unless prohibited by Agent
--Sex offender registration pursuant to 973.048(2m)
--No contact with any female under 18 years of age except supervised contact with biological children, per Agent
--Contact with grandchildren as permitted by Agent
--Submit DNA Sample upon demand

Arresting Agency:  Watertown PD

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

timeConds.notes:
To commence on or before 1/18/15 by 7:00 pm
--With Huber/Work-release privileges

--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in his/her system.  Non-compliance will result in loss of Huber/work-release privileges without further process.

01-05-2015 The Court orders the verbage on the JOC be corrected re: sentence transfer to read "Sentence may transfer to another county-any county that will match his work needs".

records.descr: Request and Order to Correct Clerical Error in JOC
Request and Order to Correct Clerical Error in JOC

records.addlTxt:
**Clerks Note**

Clerk verified with Court Reporter taht Judge O'Brien ordered "Sentence may transfer to another county - any county that will match his work needs." Not as the 12/19/14 minutes indicate.
Note to the court ref evaluation submitted by the defense on 12-09-2014//Court advises it is not to be sealed
Letter submitted by Defense at plea and sentencing

Case called at 8:38 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Sarah O'Brien presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Robert J Loderbauer in court with Attorney Michael C. Witt. ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Service of the AMENDED complaint admitted; reading waived

Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered on Counts #1 & #2; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.

On Counts #1 & #2, the Court IMPOSES & STAYS 9 MONTHS JAIL, PER COUNT, CONSECUTIVE TO EACH OTHER AND CONSECUTIVE TO ANY OTHER SENTENCE IN BEING and places the Defendant on Probation for 3 years, each count, concurrent, with conditions: 
--serve 6 months in Jefferson County Jail, (on Ct#1) with Huber/Work-release privileges; to commence on or before 1/18/15 by 7:00 pm 
--Follow-through with all treatment recommendations of Dr. Cummings or any other treatment providers
--To undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--To maintain employment 
--No possession/use of any computer, cell phone or other device with internet or texting capabilities unless expressly approved by Agent but may use computer for employment purposes only unless prohibited by Agent
--Sex offender registration pursuant to 973.048(2m)
--No contact with any female under 18 years of age except supervised contact with biological children, per Agent
--Contact with grandchildren as permitted by Agent
--To pay costs of $486 ($243 each count)
--To pay $400 DNA Surcharge ($200 eac count)
--Submit DNA Sample upon demand
Sentence may transfer to another county as long as electronic monitoring is not utilized

Days credit for time already served: 0 days
Recess: 9:10 am
with cover letter submitted by Defense
Preliminary hearing on December 19, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Case called at 11:01 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Robert Mawdsley presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Robert J Loderbauer in court with Attorney Michael C. Witt. DA Susan V. Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Witt: Close to resolution, but do need some additional time, parties agree matter can be set for preliminary hearing in approx. 30 days. If matter comes to resolution and it is day like today, will enter plea and have sentencing adjourned.
DA Happ: Agreed
Court reminds Mr. Loderbauer that his bond/conditions of release remain in effect

NEXT: (1) Schedule Preliminary Hearing 12/19/14 at 8:30 am - Send notices
Status conference on November 14, 2014 at 09:30 am.

Case called at 1:28 pm  [Reserve Judge Nettesheim presiding for Br. 4]
Defendant Robert J Loderbauer in court with Attorney Michael C. Witt. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney Witt advises that there are talks of a resolution, requests another status 5-6 weeks out.
ADA Hall has no objection.
Court will set for status, bail remains as previously fixed.

recess: 1:31 pm
NEXT: (Notices to be mailed)
Status: 11/14/14 at 9:30 am
Status conference on October 3, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on September 17, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
for the continuance of the 8/21/14 Status Conference
Status conference on August 21, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on August 13, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Case called at 8:37 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Robert Mawdsley presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Robert J Loderbauer in court with Attorney Michael C. Witt. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Service of Complaint admitted; Atty Witt advises that DOB & address are accurate on complaint; reading waived; maximum penalties recited
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived upon agreement of parties 

Court requires a $2000 signature bond, with conditions:
-Restricted use of internet for work purposes only
-No contact with any minors under the age of 18, except his own children

NEXT: (1) DA Pre-trial Conference scheduled for 8/13/14 at 10:00 am - Send notices (2) STC scheduled for at 8/21/14 at 3:00 pm - Send notices
